TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ClrObjectFactory extends System.Object implements class System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IClrObjectFactory

Docs.summary: Activates SOAP-enabled COM+ application proxies from a client.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.ClrObjectFactory> is used internally by the .NET Framework. You do not need to use the class directly in your code.

MemberSignature.Value: public object CreateFromVroot (string VrootUrl, string Mode);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object CreateFromVroot(string VrootUrl, string Mode) cil managed
Public Function CreateFromVroot (VrootUrl As String, Mode As String) As Object
public: virtual System::Object ^ CreateFromVroot(System::String ^ VrootUrl, System::String ^ Mode);
abstract member CreateFromVroot : string * string -> obj override this.CreateFromVroot : string * string -> obj

Docs.param: The virtual root URL of the object to be activated.
Docs.summary: Activates a remote assembly through .NET remoting, using the virtual root URL of the remote assembly.
Docs.returns: An instance of the representing the type, with culture, arguments, and binding and activation attributes set to , or if the assembly identified by the parameter is not found.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.ClrObjectFactory.CreateFromVroot%2A> appends the string "?wsdl" to `VrootUrl` and calls <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.ClrObjectFactory.CreateFromWsdl%2A> to activate the remote object.
The version of SOAP used by .NET remoting is RPC/encoded, not document/literal, which is required for SOAP interoperability. Therefore, <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.ClrObjectFactory.CreateFromVroot%2A> will not work with most ASMX Web services.
<xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.ClrObjectFactory.CreateFromVroot%2A> requires administrative privileges on the local computer the first time it is run, because it creates and installs a client proxy for communication with the remote assembly.

Docs.exception: A caller in the call chain does not have permission to access unmanaged code.
The thread token could not be opened.
Docs.permission: for the ability to call unmanaged code. Associated enumeration: .

MemberSignature.Value: public object CreateFromWsdl (string WsdlUrl, string Mode);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object CreateFromWsdl(string WsdlUrl, string Mode) cil managed
Public Function CreateFromWsdl (WsdlUrl As String, Mode As String) As Object
public: virtual System::Object ^ CreateFromWsdl(System::String ^ WsdlUrl, System::String ^ Mode);
abstract member CreateFromWsdl : string * string -> obj override this.CreateFromWsdl : string * string -> obj

Docs.param: The WSDL URL of the Web service.
Docs.summary: Activates a remote assembly through .NET remoting, using the Web Services Description Language (WSDL) of the XML Web service.
Docs.returns: An instance of the representing the type, with culture, arguments, and binding and activation attributes set to , or if the assembly identified by the parameter is not found.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Processes the WSDL passed in and, if necessary, generates a proxy, then activates the remote object.
The version of SOAP used by .NET remoting is RPC/encoded, not document/literal, which is required for SOAP interoperability. Therefore, <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.ClrObjectFactory.CreateFromWsdl%2A> will not work with most ASMX Web services.
<xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.ClrObjectFactory.CreateFromWsdl%2A> requires administrative privileges on the local computer the first time it is run, because it creates and installs a client proxy for communication with the remote assembly.

Docs.exception: A caller in the call chain does not have permission to access unmanaged code.
The thread token could not be opened.
Docs.permission: for the ability to call unmanaged code. Associated enumeration: .
